entry.name: jQuery.isArray
entry.title: jQuery.isArray()

argument.name: obj
argument.desc: Object to test whether or not it is an array.

entry.desc: Determine whether the argument is an array.

longdesc.p: $.isArray() returns a Boolean indicating whether the argument is a JavaScript array. It will only return true for real arrays, not array-like objects (e.g. the jQuery object).

JavaScript's typeof operator returns "object" for arrays, and this can make it difficult to differentiate between regular objects (e.g. the window object) and arrays (e.g. created with an array literal, []). This is why $.isArray() exists.

example.desc: Finds out if the parameter is an array.
